DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Exceptional Responder Disease Progression Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The disease progression status of exceptional responders after treatment for which the exceptional response was experienced.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Disease Progression Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The worsening of a disease over time._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A cancer patient showing either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent._The worsening of a disease over time._A condition or state at a particular time.

PermissibleValues.value: No sign of progression at last contact following treatment for which exceptional response was experienced
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Exceptional Responder Post Therapeutic Procedure No Sign Disease Progression

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Exceptional Responder Post Therapeutic Procedure No Sign Disease Progression
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cancer patient showing either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining healthcare provider.: The worsening of a disease over time.

Concepts.definition: A cancer patient showing either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining healthcare provider.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

PermissibleValues.value: Progressed following treatment for which exceptional response was experienced
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Exceptional Responder Post Therapeutic Procedure Disease Progression
